premise_source_doc_sentence: The arthritis may be `` additive ''  (  more joints become inflamed in addition to the primarily affected one  )  or `` migratory ''  (  new joints become inflamed after the initially inflamed site has already improved  )  .
The surgical procedure can be performed arthroscopically or by opening the joint to remove the synovial tissue surrounding the joint that has become inflamed and swollen .
Once the joint has become inflamed and stiff , damage is done to the joint and the growth of the joint may by changed or impaired .
In most cases , juvenile arthritis is caused by the body attacking its own healthy cells and tissues causing the joint to become inflamed and stiff .
When the synovium becomes inflamed or irritated , it increases fluid production , resulting in warmth , tenderness , and swelling in and around the joint .
